title: العَطْف
description: Learn about العطف (conjunction), one of the التوابع (followers), and the various conjunction particles (حروف العطف) and their specific meanings.

notes.title: What is العطف?
content: العطف (conjunction) connects a following word (المعطوف) to a preceding word (المعطوف عليه) using a conjunction particle (حرف العطف).
The conjoined word takes the same grammatical case as the word it follows. If the first is مرفوع, the second is also مرفوع.
keyPoints: العطف connects two words sharing the same grammatical function
المعطوف follows المعطوف عليه in case (إعراب)
Part of the four التوابع: النعت، التوكيد، العطف، البدل

examples.english: I saw the student and the teacher
I traveled to Egypt then Morocco

notes.title: Conjunction Particles - Part 1
content: The main conjunction particles are: وَ (and), فَ (and then), ثُمَّ (then, later). Each has a specific meaning.
وَ simply adds without implying order. فَ implies immediate sequence. ثُمَّ implies sequence with a delay.
keyPoints: وَ (wa): simple addition, no order implied - جَاءَ زَيْدٌ وَعَمْرٌو
فَ (fa): immediate sequence - دَخَلَ فَجَلَسَ (he entered then sat immediately)
ثُمَّ (thumma): sequence with delay - أَكَلْتُ ثُمَّ شَرِبْتُ (I ate, then later drank)
حَتَّى (hatta): means 'even' or 'until' - جَاءَ الطُّلَّابُ حَتَّى الْمَرِيضُ

examples.english: I ate the fish, even its head

notes.title: Conjunction Particles - Part 2
content: Other conjunction particles include: أَوْ (or), أَمْ (or - in questions), بَلْ (rather), لَكِنْ (but), لَا (not).
These particles convey different relationships: choice, correction, exception, or negation.
keyPoints: أَوْ (aw): choice or doubt - هَذَا قَلَمٌ أَوْ مِسْطَرَةٌ (this is a pen or ruler)
أَمْ (am): exclusive choice in questions - أَجَاءَ زَيْدٌ أَمْ عَمْرٌو؟
بَلْ (bal): correction - مَا جَاءَ زَيْدٌ بَلْ عَمْرٌو (Zaid didn't come, rather Amr)
لَكِنْ (lakin): contrast - مَا جَاءَ زَيْدٌ لَكِنْ عَمْرٌو
لَا (la): negating the second - جَاءَ زَيْدٌ لَا عَمْرٌو (Zaid came, not Amr)

examples.english: Do you want tea or coffee?
This is not a pen, rather a key
The student passed, not the lazy one
